title: Dearest Riot
body:
My question to you on this particular evening comes from a very bad 45 minutes of my life, due to some of the consumers of a product you have created. I am curious to know if I am obligated to stay in a Ranked game where I am battling a 4v5 with one AFK/DCed player on my team, when my teammates are being extremely rude and mildly racist to me and each other. 

Much love,
Tacohandler, the one and only.

replies.body:
Buenos Dias Tacohandler!

I completely understand the frustration when you end up playing on the short side of a 4v5. Far more often than not, being a champ short in your comp can equal a death sentence for the team.

Some of the ways I've dealt with this is to change my win conditions. If I accept that the game will likely end in defeat, I make side-games that I can have fun with and secure a personal victory. Seeing how many times I can steal a baron/dragon is one of my go-to quests, but you can go wild with your imagination. Focusing on catching one specific enemy champ out of position, stealing buffs from the jungle, going full mobility and distracting the other team with merry chases are all fun options too. 

 As for the toxicity, a simple muting is always a great way to combat it. Just don't forget to report them after the game so that they can get what they deserve! :)

> 
> Some of the ways I've dealt with this is to change my win conditions. If I accept that the game will likely end in defeat, I make side-games that I can have fun with and secure a personal victory. Seeing how many times I can steal a baron/dragon is one of my go-to quests, but you can go wild with your imagination. Focusing on catching one specific enemy champ out of position, stealing buffs from the jungle, going full mobility and distracting the other team with merry chases are all fun options too. 

As much fun as it sounds to create side-games and doing my best to be a pain in the rear end for the other team to beat. The fact still remains that in 4v5 you are losing LP, something you've been building up over time that you've dedicated to the game. 

More importantly you lose LP from an event outside of your control that has nothing to do with you or your remaining teammates skill level. You get punished for someone else's foolish choice to leave the game or never show up for it in the first place. Fair? I think not. 

As much as I want to play the game for fun and believe in comebacks, 4v5 in ranked is ff at 20 in my opinion.

That's a fair point, and I agree it sucks. But if you're locked into a game you might as well make those 20 minutes as amusing and useful as possible before the ff, no?

Also, statistically, an enemy team is just as likely to have an afk/dc as yours is. You might lose LP in the cases that are inopportune to your team, but you also reap the benefits when their team is missing a player. Not saying that the situation is ideal by any means, but over the lifetime of playing league you'll have balance. 

Can we (Riot) do better to address the pain? Sure! And some really smart dudes are constantly building up new ways to solve the problem. For example, the Player Behavior team has already done some really awesome stuff with leaverbuster recently, and it's showing a lot of promise.

Really tired of hearing the same lines from riot for five years. The problem with leaverbuster is that it doesn't solve the problem that your ranked game was just ruined by a leaver, who may or may not be punished at some future point.

It would be really simple to fix this. If someone leaves for x amount of time (say 10 minutes), everyone on the losing team gets 0 LP loss and no MMR (Elo) loss, except for the leaver, who gets a triple lp loss. 

If you are in a duo and do this, both duo players take the lp hit to prevent duo's from abusing it.

No one is going to leave/afk a game if they are going to get a triple lp loss, the other 4 players wont all feel like trash either now that they know they wont have any lp loss.

I really can't imagine why a system like this wasn't put into place years ago. Oh wait, actually I can imagine that someone thought it would be abused somehow, but who is going to leave and take that huge lp loss to save 4 people they don't even know. No one is going to do that, on top of the fact that you have to leave for 10 minutes before it activates, so at the point that someone is going to "be a hero" and take one for the team, it must already be a point in the game that they are decisively losing. Therefor the team living for another 10 minutes down a player isn't likely to happen.

Not only would this system be more fair for everyone, you don't have to wait for a future payoff of "well eventually, statistically, the other team will have a leaver". This breeds toxic behavior, because while you want to feel sorry for the other team having a leaver/afk,  at the same time you think "well good, it's finally my turn for all the leavers i have gotten!". This should not be the mentality you want to foster.

You do present some points that I completely empathize with, but I disagree that an ultimate solution is as simple as you represent it to be. Immediately I think about the really awful experience of unintentionally getting disconnected from the game due to a technical issue that the average player can't fix right away, and then getting slammed by a negative 4x loss in LP. I wholeheartedly agree that the situation sucks, but I cant see the solution being one where a significant number of players are punished disproportionate to their crime. **If** we eliminate unintentional disconnects at some point in the future, I'd say go for it. Until then there has to be some thought toward collateral damage, right?


I'm not a subject matter expert in the area of Player Behavior/leaver so maybe my thoughts are off base, but I've heard that the work put in by that team is creating a more positive experience than we've had before. For specific data about the gains from those changes you'll need to hear from a Rioter directly involved. They may not be ready to share it just yet, but I suspect that more could be shared in the future, and by someone more knowledgeable than myself. :)

Thanks for the reply. You are very diplomatic in your responses, which is nice. I am going to be blunt though. I played 3 games today. One game I got trolled, and one game a guy ragequit after dying 3 times. Two free losses out of three total games. I've dealt with this for a long time. It's getting really old, and really frustrating. I know statistically, whatever, but I must be some kind of statistical outlier, because it is insane how often this happens. In ranked.

I understand that you dont want to punish someone that may have disconnected unintentionally, but right now, you are punishing the entire team for not doing anything wrong. 

What I am saying is, whatever solution is put into place, the other four players should not ever lose lp because of a leaver. Would be nice if you wouldnt lose lp due to trolls either, but I understand how that would be difficult to implement.

Thanks again for your time.

> Also, statistically, an enemy team is just as likely to have an afk/dc as yours is. You might lose LP in the cases that are inopportune to your team, but you also reap the benefits when their team is missing a player. Not saying that the situation is ideal by any means, but over the lifetime of playing league you'll have balance. 

As someone who has heard this argument used for all the years I've played, I'll tell you this right now.

This statistics argument rings **REALLY HOLLOW** and while* I am certain you aren't using it this way*, but more often than not sounds like a justification for leaving things as is.


This is a 5v5 game, not a 1v1. Therefore while you are statistically in a more advantageous spot, such statistics hardly expresses themselves in a case-by-case basis, you won't see noticeable results until hundreds upon hundreds of games.

Secondly, unless the game is super-extreme epic fun-times, **you will not remember the good game nearly as well as every single unfair game you've lost**, and that's a lot of unfair games to remember. In short, the negative games almost always outweighs the positive one.


Also the team of 5's in a 5v4 are almost always dicks about it, spamming taunts and laughs as the minions slowly destroy the Nexus. That doesn't help.


Last but not least, losing an unfair 4v5 match is really shitty, this goes without saying. But winning a 5v4 is NOT vilifying, it does NOT make up for the horrible feeling that you lost those 4v5 matches. Why? Because deep down you know you didn't earn that win. That win is un-earned. It's unsatisfying. It's unfun. Imagine having a losing streak...only to have the bad streak be broken down because of such an unfairly tilted game. Does that sound very fun?

-----------------------
COMBINE ALL THAT...with the mere fact that it's entirely possible to just have a bad game even with a full team. You can see there are some issues.

The afk/dc situation is something that is being worked on by several teams that house geniuses in comparison to myself. It's an iterative process and it's slower than I would prefer, but progress *is* being made.

Ah you misunderstand. I KNOW that's most likely not what you meant as a Rioter.


What I mean is it sounds more like it the more you hear it, doesn't help that literally everyone else (non-Rioters) actually do think that justifies the way it currently is. 


Sry for not being clearer.

You were pretty clear. In this case my response was mostly directed toward others that might not pick up on what you meant, and truly believe that we're comfortable with things as they are.

Your points are valid and well received. :)
k no harsh feelings

I do believe both in that you are all trying to fix it and that statistically it is just as likely to happen to both sides. Is that enough though? I have played since the middle of season three and have been a big fan of your game since match one. I usually do not play more than one or two games at a time and relish the chance to devote my free time to getting better at a game with some deeper value and strategy. I have tried hard to get better from watching videos of streamers and practicing to learn my role as best as I can. I will most likely win out in the end as I have an above 50% win rate so as long as I play hundreds of ranked games I can climb to where the better players are and theoretically will be with more people who take the game seriously like me. Sadly I do not think I want to put myself through that, nor should I have to. It is not worth it if you think about it since the whole point of any game is to have fun. To put it in perspective I do have fun when I lose to a better team. When I get outplayed I respect my opponent and try not to make the same mistake. There has to be a better way, the only requirement for ranked cannot just be to reach level thirty and being locked out of ranked should be a very easy penalty to get. I have sunk a lot of time and money into your game and am currently going to school for animation and had considered applying when I graduate; but, I am very, very close to leaving this whole game in the past as the concept of trying your best only to lose because some child of a person that will likely grow up to be a skid mark on the underwear of society doesn't care at all is unacceptable to me. I may not matter that much to you as only one player but it has to stop free game or not nobody deserves this.

This is true. Even if I've hated having afk in rank, I've also won ranked matches cause of enemy afk. Sometimes I feel bad about it especially if the enemy isn't doing too well anyways.

One thing I hate though is the whole debate of "Oh, we'd win if we'd have 5 people cause we were beating you early". Like even if that's true, the enemy doesn't have to get so freaking obnoxious about it. When they get like that and keep harping about it, then I don't feel bad for the 5v4 and enjoy beating them.

2 things people shouldn't do when there's an afk. Though I've seen some 4-man teams pull it together and still beat the 5-man team, but anyways.

1. The 5-man winning team shouldn't gloat about winning and just play.

2. The 4-man losing team shouldn't constantly be whining about "Oh, we'd be winning if we had 5 people, so why don't your most fed player afk to make it even". Like no. Truth or not, it's really annoying to hear that...for...the...entire...freaking match.

Statistically you can have 1,77 kids per familly. So... This is not an excuse to leave this problem without any solution for years. 

All you have to do is to implement new mechanic to ranked games. If someone won't connect at start of the game, then he have 5 min to do so. If not game ends as draw and the dc guy gets normal afk penalty.

That is what you can do if you really care about your players, without allowing others to make some kind of abuse with it.

Is there any chance that tech could be implemented to remind people of whom they muted postgame? What I find is that when I mute a player, I forget that they were problematic (unless they did something like spammed pings to harass players) and then I don't report them because I forget a report was necessary.

There's certainly a possibility that it could be implemented in the future, but I don't work on the team that would build that so I can't promise it.
In the meantime, are there some other ways you could set reminders for yourself during the game?

Maybe, but like, half the point of muting somebody is to reduce the impact they'll have on my emotions (and thus my ingame effectiveness) and if I were to take a pad of paper and scribble "Grr, 420PoOnHoUnDxx makes me SO MAD" or something, then not only might I forget to look at it when the option to report comes up, but if I don't, then it might weigh on my mind despite the fact that I muted him... kind of a lose-lose proposition.

I'd rather forget to report than let a toxic player hinder me, but I want to make sure that those sorts of people learn that that sort of behavior is 100% not okay. I've lost count of the number of times people have told me that "nobody cares about" things like racial/sexual slurs or even telling other players to uninstall and then kill themselves.

Obviously those players will get hit with reports naturally over time but it just irrationally bothers me, y'know?

I'm pretty sure they're still on mute when you head into the post-game lobby and this is indicated.

I-isn't it?

I swear I've used exactly that to know when to report people postgame.

I don't think so...? I'm sure I've had people in postgame continue to curse me out as if I'd heard a word they said during the prior 20 minutes.

If this is a thing then it isn't a very visible thing.
So sed, though protecting  other people from toxic players is my daily routine...Even I do get a little rude,though I never swear/say racist things.
